introduction: The following passage is adapted from Quantum Leap: Explorations in Physics by Dr. Wei Li (2021).
text: The double-slit experiment demonstrates the wave-particle duality of electrons. Surprisingly, each electron, although fired individually, ______ an interference pattern over time, suggesting it interferes with itself.
question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English? Consider the singular subject electron and the continuing relevance of the phenomenon.
explanation: Choice C is correct because each electron is a singular subject and present tense (produces) is used to discuss a phenomenon still valid today. A produced places the event strictly in the past. B produce is plural. D will producing is grammatically incorrect.
